Article Title: Kerala man, 31, feared killed in Ukraine war
Article Text: THRISSUR: One of two youths from Thrissur district trapped in the Russia-Ukraine conflict zone ie believed to have been killed during a battle, according to a verbal message received by his family members from the Indian embassy in Russia.Family sources said embassy officials confirmed to his wife Joicy, who had contacted them, that her husband Binil Babu (31), from Kuttanellur here, fell to bullets of Ukrainian forces.However, neither family members nor Non-Resident Keralite Affairs department (NoRKA) officials have received any official communication. There is also no communication on when Babu was killed, where, and how.Babu’s cousin Jain Kurien (27) of Kuranchery, near Wadakkanchery, the second youth trapped in Russia, also suffered injuries in the battle. Jain has sent a message to the family that he was subjected to surgery and shifted to Moscow. When contacted, NoRKA officials said embassy officials had not given any confirmation about Babu’s death despite repeated calls.Babu, an electrician-cum-plumber, and Jain, an automobile mechanic, had gone to Russia on April 4 last year with the help of one of their relatives.They were offered jobs in canteens by their agent, but that did not materialise. Eventually, they had to take Russian citizenship and join the Russian army.On Dec 16 last year they sent a message to the family that they were being taken to the warfront and might not return, following which many interventions were made at various levels for their release.The head of the Orthodox Syrian Church, Baselios Marthoma Mathews III Catholicos, took up the issue directly with the Russian ambassador to India.There were reports of Babu’s death since Wednesday last week, but no official confirmation was forthcoming.Reports of Babu’s death have sent shock waves in the family. His wife Joicy had delivered a baby about five months ago and Babu had not seen the baby.
Article Summary: Binil Babu (31) is believed to have been killed during a battle. His cousin Jain Kurien (27) also suffered injuries in the battle. Neither family members nor Non-Resident Keralite Affairs department (NoRKA) officials have received any official communication.

Article Title: Colleague hacks woman with cleaver in office parking lot as people watch
Article Text:
Shubhada was attacked by 27-year-old Krishna Satyanarayan Kanojia on Tuesday, allegedly because she refused to return money borrowed from him on false pretext.

Poll How Should Employers Handle Workplace Conflicts? Implement Zero-Tolerance Policies for Violence Provide Mediation and Conflict Resolution Support

PUNE: A 25-year-old BPO worker, Shubhada Kodare, was hacked to death with a cleaver by a colleague in the parking lot of her office, while two dozen people remained mute spectators.Shubhada was attacked by 27-year-old Krishna Satyanarayan Kanojia on Tuesday, allegedly because she refused to return money borrowed from him on false pretext. She succumbed to injuries late Tuesday at a private hospital. Kanojia was arrested and investigation is on.A grainy minute-long video of the attack surfaced online Thursday, which showed the attacker calmly walking about with the cleaver before Shubhada slumped to the ground and a pool of blood formed around her. While 20-odd people witnessed the scene unfold on premises of the BPO where both the accused and the victim worked, none moved to stop the attacker. Some grabbed the assailant only after he tossed away the cleaver.Additional commissioner of police Manoj Patil said probe revealed that both Shubhada and Kanojia were working as executives in the accounts department of the BPO at Ramwadi in Yerawada. About a year ago, Shubhada, of Karad in Satara, told Kanojia that she needed money to support treatment of her father. He lent her money several times adding up to Rs 4 lakh.A few months ago, she informed Kanojia that her father would be operated upon. After a few days, Kanojia, as a good gesture, visited her father. He was shocked to learn that her father did not have any health issues.After this, Kanojia demanded his money back, but she picked arguments and lodged a non-cognisable offence against him three months ago, Patil said. He kept pursuing her to get his money back, but she avoided him and did not answer his calls."Enraged, Kanojia came prepared and attacked her," he said.
Article Summary: Shubhada Kodare, 25, was hacked to death with a cleaver by a colleague in the parking lot of her office. She was attacked by 27-year-old Krishna Satyanarayan Kanojia on Tuesday. He allegedly attacked her because she refused to return money borrowed from him on false pretext.

Article Title: 9 cops in SIT probing Beed sarpanch murder replaced with 6 CID officials
Article Text: MUMBAI: State government has removed nine cops from the SIT probing the Massajog sarpanch murder case in Beed. The cops were replaced by six state CID officials including an additional superintendent of police to maintain impartiality in the probe, as per a govt resolution issued on Monday.Santosh Deshmukh, sarpanch of Massajog village in Kej tehsil of Beed, was abducted and murdered on Dec 9.Earlier, NCP (SP) leader Jitendra Awhad had raised concerns about a sub-inspector from Beed police who was part of the SIT, citing a photograph showing the officer's association with Valmiki Karad, a suspect in the case.Karad, a close associate of minister Dhananjay Munde , turned himself in to state CID earlier this month. CID subsequently arrested him in a separate case of extortion.While Karad maintains his innocence, citing political motivation behind the accusation against him in the murder case, opposition parties allege he is the prime accused.The state formed an SIT, led by CID deputy inspector general Basavraj Teli and consisting nine Beed cops, through a GR to probe the murder case on Jan 1.Sources said CM Devendra Fadnavis personally called up Beed SP Navneet Kanwat and Teli to review the progress of the case. "Fadnavis said no mercy should be shown to anyone found guilty. Strict action must be taken against all responsible," sources added.(With agency inputs)
Article Summary: Santosh Deshmukh, sarpanch of Massajog village in Kej tehsil of Beed, was abducted and murdered on Dec 9. The cops were replaced by six state CID officials including an additional superintendent of police to maintain impartiality in the probe.

Article Title: Five killed as bus falls into 100-metre gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal
Article Text:
Wreckage of a bus that crashed on the motorway, in Pauri Garhwal district. (PTI Photo)

Poll What Do You Think Is the Main Cause of Accidents Like These? Human Error and Speeding Narrow Roads in Hilly Areas

NEW DELHI: A bus accident claimed five lives and injured 16 others when the vehicle plunged into a 100-metre-deep ditch near Uttarakhand's Dahalchori area in Pauri Garhwal District, officials confirmed on Sunday.Pauri Garhwal, District Magistrate Ashish Chauhan stated that the incident resulted in five fatalities and left more than 10 individuals with injuries.SDRF Commander Arpan Yaduvanshi stated that the bus lost control before falling into the deep ditch. SDRF teams have arrived at the location and are conducting rescue operations, he added.In a later update, SDRF said, "There were a total of 28 people on the bus, out of which 5 people died on the spot while 1 person died during the treatment. The remaining 16 people are undergoing treatment."Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his condolences and provided updates about the rescue efforts earlier in the day."Very sad news was received about the death of four passengers due to a bus accident on the way to Kendriya Vidyalaya in Pauri. I pray to God to grant the souls of the departed a place in His feet and provide strength to the bereaved family to bear this pain. Relief and rescue operations are underway by the local administration and the injured are being treated at the nearest hospital. I pray to Baba Kedar for the speedy recovery of the injured," CM Dhami wrote on X.
Article Summary: Bus plunged into a 100-metre-deep ditch near Uttarakhand's Dahalchori area. SDRF teams have arrived at the location and are conducting rescue operations. Pauri Garhwal, District Magistrate Ashish Chauhan stated that the incident resulted in five fatalities and more than 10 injuries.

Article Title: Greg Gutfeld criticized Travis Kelce's girlfriend Taylor Swift for mixing politics and entertainment
Article Text:
Image via Getty Images

Greg Gutfeld took a jab at Taylor Swift

Gutfeld: The left’s ‘matrix of hoaxes’ is ‘imploding’

Fox News personality Greg Gutfeld , the host of a comedy-news hybrid show called Gutfeld that features unapologetic humor often bordering on politically incorrect jokes and body shaming, took aim at pop sensation Taylor Swift in the most recent episode of his program.Gutfeld is an American television host, political commentator, comedian, and author. Until March 2021, when the program became a weeknight offering, Gutfeld was the host of the late-night comedy talk show Gutfeld!, with its Saturday night version being known as The Greg Gutfeld Show.Greg Gutfeld, a comedian, took a jab at Taylor Swift saying she wasn't very smart and had a long list of break-ups. During an interview recently, Gutfeld targeted Swift's height and declared her a six at best. Gutfeld said, “Taylor Swift is a six at best,” sparking loud cheers from the audience.Gutfeld described "The Trump Effect" as the freedom to say what people knew, as opposed to what the media was saying, without fear of retribution. He said the election of Donald Trump marked a turning point in the change in society, making once censored opinions safe to say without consequence.Friday's episode marked the second hosted by Gutfeld in two months, following a paternity leave for his daughter's birth. Gutfeld, known for his sharp wit, has often directed biting humor at powerful figures, comparing President Biden to a corpse and fat-shaming The View's ladies.Gutfeld continues to criticize celebrities for blending politics and entertainment, a trend he's previously used to mock Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris . “Apparently, this singer wanted to show she can make bad choices about women too.” Swift was accused of exploiting her fan base by promoting personal political agendas, disregarding Harris' efforts to address border and economic issues during her Vice President tenure.Also Read: “Never seen a referee huddle with a QB”: Fans trash Josh Allen and head referee Bill Vinovich after they were seen talking during Bills vs Broncos Greg Gutfeld is not alone in his criticism of politically vocal celebrities. Former Fox News journalist Kelly also criticized politically vocal celebrities like Taylor Swift, Jennifer Lopez, and Beyoncé for their failed attempts to correct their public image, claiming that Hollywood's "big loser" celebrities have been rejected by fans, with audiences more concerned with Lopez's appearance than her political beliefs.
Article Summary: Greg Gutfeld took aim at pop sensation Taylor Swift in the most recent episode of his program. Gutfeld is an American television host, political commentator, comedian, and author. He described "The Trump Effect" as the freedom to say what people knew, as opposed to what the media was saying.

Article Title: Wildfires in Los Angeles: Inferno claims 24 lives, thousands flee homes, wealthy hire private firefighters for $2,000 per hour
Article Text:
California wildfires

Mounting death toll and growing concerns

Los Angeles Wildfires Latest: 24 dead in Southern California fires - Jan. 12 update

Scenes of devastation: Residents survey the ruins

Dramatic doorbell footage of father fleeing LA wildfire | Hellfire short documentary | 7NEWS

Firefighting efforts

: Collaborative battle

The role of

private firefighters

Canada fights California wildfires despite Trump threats

Water shortages: Crisis within a crisis

Rebuilding and recovery: Daunting task

Political fallout and leadership challenges

Los Angeles is reeling under the devastating impact of multiple wildfires that have claimed at least 24 lives, destroyed thousands of homes, and forced over 150,000 residents to evacuate. As firefighters race against time to contain the blazes, fierce Santa Ana winds and a severe lack of rainfall have turned the city into a battleground, with flames ravaging entire neighborhoods. With officials warning of worsening conditions, the situation remains dire as the community grapples with the immense toll of the disaster.The death toll from the wildfires ravaging the Los Angeles area has climbed to 24, with 16 people still reported missing. This tragic update comes as firefighters brace for the return of strong Santa Ana winds, which are expected to intensify through midweek, with gusts reaching up to 65 mph in mountainous regions.Los Angeles County Fire Chief Anthony Marrone expressed concern about the forecast, emphasizing the challenges ahead. “We are prepared for the upcoming wind event,” he said, noting that additional water trucks and fire retardants are being deployed to mitigate the spread of flames.Evacuation orders have displaced over 150,000 residents, leaving many to wonder about the fate of their homes. Some have been allowed to return, only to find neighborhoods reduced to ashes.Altadena resident Jim Orlandini, who lost his hardware store but found his home intact, described the ordeal. “The whole time I was thinking, I don’t know what I’m going to find when I get back here. After 40 years, you have so much to lose. We’re thankful it didn’t.”The fires, which began last week, have consumed more than 62 square miles, leveling entire neighborhoods in Pasadena and the Palisades. Authorities have warned that the number of fatalities and missing individuals may rise as cadaver dogs continue systematic searches.Nearly 14,000 personnel, including teams from other states and Mexico, are on the ground. Their efforts have been bolstered by 1,400 fire engines and 84 aircraft. Even inmates from California’s prison system are assisting, although the program has faced criticism due to its low wages for dangerous work.Despite progress, officials warn that some fires remain active and highly dangerous. LA Fire Chief Kristin Crowley urged residents to stay away from scorched neighborhoods, citing risks like broken gas lines and unstable structures.Wealthy residents in Los Angeles are increasingly turning to private firefighting services, paying up to $2,000 per hour to protect their homes, reported the New York Post. While these private crews employ advanced equipment and techniques, their use has sparked outrage among the general public.Critics argue that these services divert resources from broader firefighting efforts. “So you’re suggesting lifesaving resources should be used to save your house because you’re rich while tens of thousands are evacuating?” read one viral post.Fire hydrants across Los Angeles have run dry, exacerbating the firefighting challenge. Up to 20% of the city’s hydrants were out of service at one point last week, forcing crews to rely on alternative water sources.Governor Gavin Newsom has called for an investigation into the failure. “We need answers to ensure this does not happen again,” he said, acknowledging mounting criticism over the state’s preparedness.Some residents, like Pacific Palisades homeowner Rachel Darvish, have voiced their frustration publicly. Darvish went viral after confronting Newsom, declaring, “I’ll fill up the hydrants myself.”The fires have destroyed over 12,000 structures, with early damage estimates reaching $150 billion. Governor Newsom has issued an executive order to expedite rebuilding, including suspending some environmental regulations and freezing property tax assessments.More than 24,000 residents have registered for federal assistance following President Joe Biden’s disaster declaration. However, rebuilding will be a long and arduous process, with officials urging the adoption of modern, fire-resistant standards.The wildfire crisis has intensified scrutiny of California’s leadership. Allegations of mismanagement, including the water shortages, have led to investigations and public outcry. Mayor Karen Bass and Governor Newsom face growing pressure to address the systemic issues that have compounded the disaster.Meanwhile, the National Weather Service has issued a rare “particularly dangerous situation” warning, underscoring the continued threat. Fire behavior analysts predict that Tuesday will be the most critical day.
Article Summary: The death toll from the wildfires ravaging the Los Angeles area has climbed to 24, with 16 people still reported missing. As firefighters race against time to contain the blazes, fierce Santa Ana winds and a severe lack of rainfall have turned the city into a battleground. Fire hydrants across Los Angeles have run dry, exacerbating the firefighting challenge. Governor Gavin Newsom has called for an investigation into the failure.
